Detailed Description

File for the audio class.

This will take care of all the loading and playing of sound and music files that are used for the program.

Member Function Documentation

void Audio::close (  ) 

Shuts down the audio components.

This should be called prior to the program ending to ensure that all the audio resources are freed from the computer.

void Audio::deleteAllMusic (  ) 

Frees all loaded music from memory.

This will unload all the loaded music from memory. Any want to play music after this requires reloading music using the loadMusic function.

void Audio::deleteAllSounds (  ) 

Frees all loaded sounds from memory.

This will unload all the loaded sounds from memory. Any want to play sounds after this requires reloading the sounds using the loadSound function.

void Audio::deleteMusic ( string  alias  ) 

Frees a specific music from memory.

This will unload the music that matches the given alias from memory. Any want to play this music afterward requires reloading it using loadMusic.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.

void Audio::deleteSound ( string  alias  ) 

Frees a specific sound from memory.

This will unload the sound that matches the given alias from memory. Any want to play this sound afterward requires reloading it using loadSound.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the sound file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadSound for that sound.

void Audio::fadeOutMusic ( int  miliSecs  ) 

Fades out music over a given time.

Will fade out any music playing over the time of the given amount of miliseconds.

Parameters:
miliSecs The number of miliseconds it takes to fully fade out the music playing.

void Audio::init (  ) 

Initializes the audio components.

This must be called prior to loading or playing any sound or music files. Nothing will play if this function is not called.

void Audio::loadMusic ( string  filename,
string  alias 
)

Loads a music file.

Loads a music file into memory so that it can be played later. This can be a WAV, MP3, OGG, MIDI, and MOD files. Suggested not to use MP3's since there can be some problems with these files during playback.

Parameters:
filename The exact location of the music file. Can use a reference or a direct location as a location for the file. Example: "./music/backgroundmusic.ogg" Means the file will be found in the running directory under the folder "music".
alias The name that will be used to reference the music later when wanting to play it back.

void Audio::loadSound ( string  filename,
string  alias 
)

Loads a sound file.

Loads a sound file into memory so that it can be played later. This should only be a WAV file.

Parameters:
filename The exact location of the WAV file. Can use a reference or a direct location as a location for the file. Example: "./sounds/boom.wav" Means the file will be found in the running directory under the folder "sounds".
alias The name that will be used to reference the sound later when wanting to play it back.

void Audio::pauseMusic (  ) 

Pauses any music playing.

Will pause any music currently playing. A subsequent call resumeMusic will replay the song where you paused it.

void Audio::playMusic ( string  alias  ) 

Plays a music file.

Plays a music file that is referenced with the given alias. Will play this music file one play through and stop.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.

void Audio::playMusicFade ( string  alias,
int  numLoops,
int  miliSecs 
)

Fades in a music file that plays multiple times.

Fades in a music file that is referenced with the given alias. Will play this music file as many of times as the number given into the function.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.
numLoops The number of times to play the song. 0 does not play it, 2 plays it 2 times, -1 plays it forever until the song is stopped or paused.
miliSecs How many miliseconds it takes to fade into the song. At the end of that time, the music should be at full volume.

void Audio::playMusicFadeFrom ( string  alias,
double  position,
int  numLoops,
int  miliSecs 
)

Plays a music file multiple times while starting from a given position and fading in.

Plays a music file that is referenced with the given alias. The song will start at a given amount of seconds into the song while fading in for a given amount of miliseconds. Will play this music file as many of times as the number given into the function.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.
position The number of seconds into the song to start playing from.
numLoops The number of times to play the song. 0 does not play it, 2 plays it 2 times, -1 plays it forever until the song is stopped or paused.
miliSecs How many miliseconds it takes to fade into the song. At the end of that time, the music should be at full volume.

void Audio::playMusicFrom ( string  alias,
double  position,
int  numLoops 
)

Plays a music file multiple times while starting from a given position.

Plays a music file that is referenced with the given alias. The song will start at a given amount of seconds into the song. Will play this music file as many of times as the number given into the function.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.
position The number of seconds into the song to start playing from.
numLoops The number of times to play the song. 0 does not play it, 2 plays it 2 times, -1 plays it forever until the song is stopped or paused.

void Audio::playMusicRepeat ( string  alias,
int  numLoops 
)

Plays a music file multiple times.

Plays a music file that is referenced with the given alias. Will play this music file as many of times as the number given into the function.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the music file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadMusic for that music.
numLoops The number of times to play the song. 0 does not play it, 2 plays it 2 times, -1 plays it forever until the song is stopped or paused.

void Audio::playSound ( string  alias  ) 

Plays a sound at full volume through all speakers.

Plays the sound that identifies with the alias given through all the speakers at full volume.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the sounds file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadSound for that sound.

void Audio::playSound3D ( string  alias,
double  xEar,
double  yEar,
double  xSrc,
double  ySrc 
)

Plays a sound through the speakers at a given location.

Plays a sound through the speakers with the correct volume and location that matches the ear and location of the sound. Sounds that come from the left side of the ear will come through mostly the left speaker. The farther away a sound is from the ear, the fainter the sound will be.

Parameters:
alias The name that references the sound file. Should match the alias that was passed in during loadSound for that sound.
xEar The x location of the listening ear.
yEar The y location of the listening ear.
xSrc The x location of where the sound is originating from.
ySrc The y location of where the sound is originating from.

void Audio::resumeMusic (  ) 

Resumes any paused music.

Will resume any music that was paused. Calling this on non-paused music does nothing.

void Audio::setMaxFullHearDistance ( double  distance  ) 

Sets the maximum distance that a sound is still heard at full volume.

Sets the maximum distance that a sound can be while still being able to hear it at full volume. Anything closer than that distance is still heard at full volume. Everything futher than this distance will sound fainter the farther it is away.

void Audio::setMaxSoundDistance ( double  distance  ) 

Sets the maximum distance to where 3D sound is heard.

Sets the maximum distance a sound can be playing while still being heard. The closer a sound is to the given distance, the fainter it sounds. If the sound is at or farther than the distance given, that sound will not be heard.

This only effects when you use playSound3D

Parameters:
distance The maximum amount of distance that 3D sounds can be heard.

void Audio::stopMusic (  ) 

Stops any playing music.

Will stop any music currently playing. Once stopped the song cannot be started again unless using playMusic or any of its counterparts that do fading and looping.
